title: Exact Font ID Please.
content:
Please help me identify the exact name of font used in this image. I really need it. Thank you in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023030612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CCC_5196.png)
author: jhaydevrou

comments.content: Thanks for the help Mr. Ryuk but it's similar but not exactly the same. I need is the exact replica of the font in the image.
Don't want to argue but that's definitely Aphrodite, doubtlessly.

I don't want to argue too sir. But I've already used Aphrodite. This is what it looks like.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023030612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CCC%20Aphrodite_6065.png)
Ryuk is correct. You must be looking at something different.

It's because you're using [Aphrodite Contextual](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023030612/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesenses/aphrodite-pro/contextual/). Switch to the regular version and that'd be ok.

The first image is the font that I'm looking for. The second image is the Aphrodite font that I've used. As you all can see sirs, there are a lot of difference between the fonts used.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023030612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CCC%20Difference_5265.png)

See my previous post for the answer.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023030612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_6204.png)
It is Aphrodite like Ryuk says - you might want to check your computer settings - they could be changing it.
Ok sirs. Thanks for all the help. I really appreciate all your time answering. Just one more thing Mr. bojev, where can I find the settings?
What program are you using to set the words?
It’s right there in the link on the web page. Just type what you want to see in the field provided.
